Steam (ST): and would eventually return to the parlor. ...I guess it's like "The North Wind and the Sun". If you force someone to stay shut in, they'll resist, but if you tell them to do whatever they want, they'll come back obediently.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …ほらあれだ。北風と太陽ってヤツ。{n}無理に閉じ込めようとするとみんな抵抗するが、じゃあどうぞお好きにというと大人しく戻ってくる。
Russian (RU): ...Похоже, тут действительно как в "Северном ветре и солнце".{n}Если ты принудишь кого‐нибудь сидеть взаперти, они будут сопротивляться этому, но стоит сказать им, что они могут поступать так, как им вздумается, как они покорно возвращаются.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Assim como na fábula. Sabe, "O Vento Norte e o Sol".{n}Se você forçar alguém a ficar preso, ele vai resistir, mas se você disser para fazer alguma coisa que eles queiram, eles vão voltar, obedientemente.

Steam (ST): When humans are born, no one has any individuality. However, when they reach their growth period, their sense of self starts to be born.

PC Japanese (JP): 人間、生まれたばかりの時は誰だって没個性だ。ところが成長期を迎え、自我ってやつが生まれ始めると、没個性なのが許せなくなる。

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Steam (ST): "The main feature of the growing period lies in an impulse to break away from your life as a kid, like a chick trying to crack open the shell of their egg. Do you know what makes children and adults different?"
Umineko Project (UP): "At the very foundation of the growing period is an impulse to escape from being a kid, much the same as a chick trying to crack the shell of their egg. Do you know what the difference between a child and an adult is?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "The whole point of the growing period is that people try to separate themselves from being a kid. It's the same impulse as a chick trying to crack the shell of their egg. Do you know what the difference between a child and an adult is?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「成長期の根底には子どもから脱却したいという、ヒヨコが殻を破るのに似た衝動がある。子どもと大人の違いは何かわかるかい？」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): [=JP]
Russian (RU): "Весь смысл периода роста заключается в том, что люди пытаются отречься от себя‐ребёнка. Это тот же порыв, что и у цыплёнка, пытающегося пробить скорлупу яйца. Знаешь ли ты разницу между ребёнком и взрослым?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Bem no começo desse período de crescimento, cada fundamento é um impulso para escapar de ser uma criança, assim como um pintinho tentando quebrar a casca de seu ovo. Você sabe qual a diferença entre uma criança e um adulto?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「成長期的本質之中，存在著一種類似於小雞破殻一般的，想要擺脫小孩子身份的衝動。知道小孩和大人的不同之處是什麼嗎？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「成长期的本质之中，存在着一种类似于小鸡破壳一般的，想要摆脱小孩子身份的冲动。知道小孩和大人的不同之处是什么吗？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "La caratteristica principale della crescita è che le persone cercando di dimostrare che non sono più bambini. È lo stesso impulso che spinge un pulcino a rompere il guscio dell'uovo. Sapete qual è la differenza tra un bambino e un adulto?"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Alla base dell'età dello sviluppo risiede l'impulso di liberarsi della propria infantilità, simile all'istinto di un pulcino di rompere il suo guscio. Conosci la differenza fra un bambino e un adulto?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Steam (ST): "No, it's experience. Adults can look down on children because children have very little life experience. The reason they snort at everything children say...is because they think kids know nothing about the real world."
Umineko Project (UP): "No, it's experience. Adults look down on children because children have very little life experience. The reason they snort and look down on children whenever they say anything is because children don't know anything about the world."

Because of that, there was a rumor between the servants that {f:5:Beatrice}‐sama's anger had been brought down upon this person..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...Yes. I heard that, just before I began working, someone who spoke badly about Beatrice-sama fell down the stairs and quit after receiving a large injury to their back. Because of that, there was a rumor between the servants that Beatrice-sama's anger had been brought down upon this person..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…はい。私が勤めを始める直前に、階段を転がり落ちて腰に大怪我をして辞めた方は、ベアトリーチェさまのことを悪く言っていたそうです。だから使用人たちは、ベアトリーチェさまのお怒りに触れたのだろうと噂しあったそうです…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…はい。私が勤めを始める直前に、階段を転がり落ちて腰に大怪我をして辞めた方は、ベアトリーチェさまのことを悪く言っていたそうです。だから使用人たちは、ベアトリーチェさまのお怒りに触れたのだろうと噂しあったそうです…」
Russian (RU): "...Да. Практически перед тем, как я начала здесь работать, я слышала, что кто‐то, дурно отзывающийся о {f:5:Беатриче}‐сама, упал с лестницы и сильно повредил себе спину, после чего уволился. Из‐за этого среди слуг распространился слух, что тот человек испытал на себе гнев {f:5:Беатриче}‐сама..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Sim. Eu ouvi que teve uma pessoa que pediu demissão logo depois de ter começado a trabalhar aqui, após cair da escada e sofrer várias lesões nas costas, por ter falado mal da {f:5:Beatrice}‐sama. Por causa disso, tem um rumor entre os serviçais de que foi a fúria da {f:5:Beatrice}‐sama que caiu sobre essa pessoa..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…是的。聽說在我快來這裡工作之前，從樓梯上滾下來導致腰部受重傷而辭職的那位，好像就說過貝阿朵莉切夫人的壞話。所以傭人們都在傳，說他應該是觸怒了貝阿朵莉切夫人…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…是的。听说在我快来这里工作之前，从楼梯上滚下来导致腰部受重伤而辞职的那位，好像就说过贝阿朵莉切夫人的坏话。所以佣人们都在传，说他应该是触怒了贝阿朵莉切夫人…」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Sì. Ho sentito che, poco prima che iniziassi a lavorare, qualcuno che aveva parlato male di Beatrice-sama è caduto dalle scale e si è dimesso dopo essersi procurato una gran ferita alla schiena. Per quel motivo, c'era una diceria fra i domestici che l'ira di Beatrice-sama sia ricaduta su quella persona..."

A causa di ciò, tra i domestici girava voce che l'ira di {f:5:Beatrice}-sama fosse ricaduta su di lei..."
Turkish (TR): "...Evet. Ben işe başlamadan hemen önce, merdivenlerden düşüp sırtından büyük bir yara aldıktan sonra işten ayrılan biri olduğunu duydum. {f:5:Beatrice}-sama hakkında kötü konuşuyormuş. Steam (ST): "...If you don't respect her, you'll suffer her wrath and get hurt. ...So, to the servants, {f:5:Beatrice}'s existence is just as credible as the story that, if you pull pranks on {c:86EF9C:Inari‐san}, you will be cursed by the {c:86EF9C:kitsune}.

Steam (ST): Of course, even though everyone accepts that curses and the like don't exist in the modern era, ...people are still afraid and still have a little respect for them.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Acho que eu já li em algum lugar que quando as forças de ocupação estavam tentando expandir um aeroporto e removeram uma Inari‐san que estava no caminho, todos os trabalhadores ficaram com uma misteriosa febre do nada.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "...There is no hidden gold. However, if the culprit is blindly sure of its existence, and if they're trying to make us solve the riddle before snatching the gold away for themselves, then I will agree it makes sense."
Umineko Project (UP): "...The hidden gold doesn't exist. However, the idea that we have a culprit who foolishly believes otherwise, wants Father's gold, and whose motive is to make us solve the riddle and then steal the gold from us, does indeed make some sense."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "The hidden gold doesn't exist. However, the culprit, who foolishly believes that it does, wants Father's gold. If their motive is to make us solve the riddle and then steal the gold from us, then I will agree that it makes sense.
PC Japanese (JP): 「…隠し黄金など存在しません。ですが、その存在を妄信する犯人が、お父様の黄金を目当てで、それを私たちに解かせて横領を企んでいるという動機は、なるほどと頷けるものがあります。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…隠し黄金など存在しません。ですが、その存在を妄信する犯人が、お父様の黄金を目当てで、それを私たちに解かせて横領を企んでいるという動機は、なるほどと頷けるものがあります」
Russian (RU): "Спрятанного золота не существует. Однако преступник, глупо верящий в его существование, хочет заполучить золото отца. Если их мотив заключается в том, чтобы заставить нас разгадать загадку, а затем украсть у нас золото, тогда я соглашусь, что это имеет смысл."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...O ouro escondido não existe. Porém, a ideia de que temos um culpado que tolamente acredita nele e quer o ouro do pai, e está usando esse motivo para nos fazer resolver o enigma e roubar o ouro de nós, acaba fazendo sentido."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…藏金什麼的根本不存在。但是，對黃金的存在深信不疑的犯人，為了得到爺爺的黃金，而催促我們解開謎題，以便趁機強奪的這一動機，倒也有讓人信服之處。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…藏金什么的根本不存在。但是，对黄金的存在深信不疑的犯人，为了得到爷爷的黄金，而催促我们解开谜题，以便趁机强夺的这一动机，倒也有让人信服之处。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "L'oro nascosto non esiste. Tuttavia, il colpevole, che scioccamente crede che esista, vuole l'oro di nostro Padre. Se il loro movente è farci risolvere l'enigma e poi rubarci l'oro, allora concordo sul fatto che abbia senso.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Non c'è nessun oro nascosto. Tuttavia, se il colpevole ambisce all'oro di nostro nonno, di cui è ciecamente convinto della sua esistenza, e se intende cospirare per farci risolvere l'enigma in modo da appropriarsene, posso ritenerla una teoria accettabile."
Turkish (TR): "...Gizli altın diye bir şey yok. Ancak, aptalca aksini düşünen ve babamın altınını isteyen bir suçlunun olabileceği fikri, ve amaçlarının bize bilmeceyi çözdürüp ardından da altını çalmak olması gerçekten de mantıklı."
